episode_title: 422 - The One With The Worst Best Man Ever

content.description: Central Perk, the gang is there, Phoebe is returning from the bathroom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s like the tenth time I’ve peed since I’ve been here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s also like the tenth time you told us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, oh I’m sorry, it must be really hard to hear! I tell ya, it’s a lot easier having three babies play Bringing in the Noise, Bringing in da Funk on your bladder! I’m so sick of being pregnant! The only happiness I get is from a cup of coffee, which of course is decaf, ‘cause—Oh! I’m pregnant!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, did…you want a cookie?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you so much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So uh, Pheebs, honey, how are those mood swings coming?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I haven’t really had any yet.
(Monica, Joey, and Chandler all shake their heads.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, here’s the ring. (Shows Chandler the wedding ring he plans on giving Emily)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Yes! A thousand times, yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, any ideas for the bachelor party yet?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! Before you start handing out wedding rings and planning bachelor parties, don’t you have to decide who your best man is gonna be?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s awkward. It’s awkward. It’s awkward.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I sort’ve already asked Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! He got to do it at your first wedding!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, I figured you’d understand. I mean, I-I’ve known him a lot longer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Ross! Look, I-I don’t have any brothers; I’ll never get to be a best man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can be the best man when I get married.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll never get to be a best man!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait-wait, so, you get to be my best man twice and I never get to be yours at all?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, you—yeah, of course you get to be my best man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about me?! You-you just said I could!
content.parenthetical: impatiently tapping Chandler on the shoulder

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not even getting married! Okay, this is a question for science fiction writers!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe you’re not picking me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, how can it not be me?!HeyHey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not even… I’m not even…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, y’know what, that’s it. From now on, Joey, I want you to be my best man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! (to Chandler) Shame about you man.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stop it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: One of the babies is kicking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought that was a good thing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not kicking me, it’s kicking one of the other babies. Oh (looks down her dress)! Don’t make me come in there!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you guys have like a big bowl I can borrow?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, there’s one right under the cabinet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why do you need it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, we’re having a big party tomorrow night. Later! (Starts for the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! Hey-hey, you planning on inviting us?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo, later. (Walks out the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!! Get your ass back here, Tribbiani!! (Joey walks back in, scared.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hormones!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What Phoebe meant to say was umm, how come you’re having a party and we’re not invited?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s Ross’s bachelor party.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sooo?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you bachelors?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you strippers?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then you’re not invited. (Starts for the door again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right fine! You’re not invited to the party we’re gonna have either.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-whoa, what party?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well umm…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The baby shower for Phoebe!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Baby shower. Wow! That sounds sooo like something I don’t want to do! Later! (Finally, he makes his exit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe I’m gonna have a party! This is so great! (Really excited) A party! (Really, really excited) Yay!! (Suddenly, she starts crying and Rachel moves to comfort her.) I don’t know why.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are talking over party plans.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is what I’ve got going for the party so far, liquor wise. Get a lot of liquor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great. Great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, now uh, in terms of the invite list, I’ve got you, me, and Chandler and I’m gonna invite Gunther ‘cause, well, we’ve been talking about this pretty loud.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I’ll be there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right—oh! Listen, I know this is your party, but I’d really like to the number of museum geeks that are gonna be there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Tell ya what, let’s not invite any of the anthropologists, only the dinosaur dudes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! We’ll need a six-pack of Zima .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey guys, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, just planning my bachelor party with my best man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, good luck trying to top the last one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, see, I don’t think it’s gonna that difficult considering this one won’t be taking place in the basement of a Pizza Hut .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m Ross. I’m Ross. I’m too good for the Hut; I’m too good for the Hut.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I gotta go pick up Ben. Everything so far sounds great Joey, just remember to keep it on the mellow side, okay? Just a couple of guys hanging out playing poker, no-no strippers or anything okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, see ya later.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See ya. (Ross exits, and Chandler moves over next to Joey, laughing.) Have fun planning your mellow bachelor party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, there’s gonna be strippers there. He didn’t say anything about no strippers.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He just said, “No strippers.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I chose not to hear that.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is returning from shopping and Rachel is there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look what I got! Look what I got! Look what I got! (She shows Rachel what she bought. She bought a little leather jacket and a little cowboy outfit for the babies.) Can you believe they make these for little people?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Little village people.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, look at this one. This is my favourite. (It’s a little pink and white dress for the girl baby.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that is so sweet!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! Phoebe is gonna love dressing them in these!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. Except, Phoebe’s not gonna be the one that gets to dress them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because she’s not gonna get to keep the babies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! We are throwing the most depressing baby shower ever!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute! Unless, we give her all gifts she can use after she’s done being pregnant. Like-like umm, regular coffee, Tequila.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, and somebody can get those leather pants she’s always wanted!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, she’s gonna love that!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe’s baby shower, she is holding those leather pants, and isn’t happy about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What the hell is this?! What, did you actually thought it would make me feel better to give me stuff that I can’t use for another two months?! This sucks! All right, what’s my next present?!

content.speaker: All
content.text: I don’t have anything. (All of the rest of the women there hide their gifts behind their backs.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross’s bachelor party. Ross is thanking Joey for the party.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey listen man, about the stripper…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good call!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, a little announcement, a little announcement. I’ve decided that my best man is, my best friend Gunther!
content.parenthetical: banging a spoon against his beer bottle

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: What’s my last name?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Central Perk?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Thanks for not marrying Rachel. (He starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-whoa-wait, Gunther don’t-don’t forget your shirt. (He gives Gunther his shirt and Gunther leaves.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey, what are those?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, little party favours, check it out! (It’s a shirt that reads, “Ross Geller, Bachelor Bash 1998”)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh! (Shows him what’s on the back, “Best Man Joey Tribbiani, with a huge picture of him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, a little announcement, I just want everyone to know that the position of my best man is still open! And uh, (to the stripper) so is the position of the bride.

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Smooth man. Yeah, you got some chilie on your neck. (Chandler checks and runs into the bathroom.) Well, I just want to say, thanks everyone, this-this was great. And hey! See you guys Monday morning. (They museum geeks wave at him.) Thanks Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey, don’t forget your shirt.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thanks! (Takes it and throws it back into the box and leaves.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, hey, museum geeks, party’s over. Okay. Wave bye-bye to the nice lady. There you go. Back to your parent’s basement. All right. (The museum geeks exit and Joey unlocks his door and lets the chick and the duck out.) Come on boys, come on out! Here you go. All right.

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Ohhh, look at the little birdies! Are those yours?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Wow, I didn’t know they let you keep chickens and ducks as pets.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah-yeah. And I got the duck totally trained. Watch this. Stare at the wall. (The duck complies.) Hardly move. (The duck complies.) Be white. (The duck complies.)

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: You are really good at that. So uh, I had fun tonight, you throw one hell of a party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh thanks. Thanks. It was great meetin’ ya. And listen if any of my friends gets married, or have a birthday, or a Tuesday…

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Yeah, that would be great. So I guess umm, good night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh unless you uh, you wanna hang around.

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. I’ll let you play with my duck.

content.description: Joey’s bedroom, it’s the middle of the night, he’s waking up and discovers he’s alone in bed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, (realises he doesn’t know her name.) stripper! (He notices that the ring box is open, so he picks it up, sees it’s empty and starts to panic.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, it’s continued from earlier. Joey is now waking Chandler and telling him the news.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The stripper stole the ring!! The stripper stole the ring!! Chandler! Chandler, get up! Get up! The stripper stole the ring!
content.parenthetical: running and banging on Chandler’s door

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The ring is gone!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ugh. Just a sec, give me a minute to wake up for this—Ah-ha-ha!! You lost the ring! You’re the worst best man ever!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, this isn’t funny! What am I gonna do?! I go to bed last night, everything’s cool! I wake up this morning, the stripper’s gone and the ring is gone!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You slept with the stripper?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course!! (Shrugs.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is entering, Monica and Rachel are talking on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Phoebe. (Both Monica and her try to move out of Phoebe’s way.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I wanted to apologise if I—y’know seemed a tad edgy yesterday at my shower. Y’know it’s just the hormones, y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No we…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hormones.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …hormones, yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Anyway, I just wanted to say thank you, it was just, it was so sweet. (She goes to hug them and they both flinch, thinking that Phoebe is about to attack them.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, you seem to be doing so much better. That’s great. So how-how are things going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good. Y’know—no-no, okay, it’s-it feels like everything’s been about me lately, so what’s happening with you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, actually we were just talking about me not going to Ross’s wedding.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It just might be too hard, given the history and all that…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! This reminds me of the time when I was umm, living on the street and this guy offered to buy me food if I slept with him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, h-how is this like that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, let’s see, it’s not. Really, like that. Because, you see that was an actual problem, and uh, yours is just like y’know a bunch of y’know high school crap that nobody really gives y’know…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m-I’m sorry, I just thought that…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alrighty, here come the water works. (Rachel starts crying harder.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is trying to figure out what to do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ugh! I don’t know what I’m going to do! I called the company that sent and th-they don’t care! Then I called 9-1-1 and they laughed at me, if this isn’t an emergency, then what is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanted to thank you again for last night, what a great party! And the guys from work had a blast. Y’know, one of them had never been to a bachelor party before. Yeah! And-and another one had never been to a party before, so…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So uh, hey, that uh, that wedding ring, huh? Man, that’s nice!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, right!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was uh, I was thinking I might want to pick one of those babies up for myself, I might want to get one of those…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That ring? When my grandmother first came to this country, that ring and the clothes on her back were all she had with her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you might say, the ring is irreplaceable? (Gives Joey a little squeeze.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh absolutely! It has been in my family for generations, and every bride who has worn it has had a long and happy life.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you might say, it’s a magic ring.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, the stripper stole it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My-my ring? My-my wedding ring? The-the stripper stole my wedding ring?! H-how?! How could this all happen?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think it all started when you said, “Hey Joey, why don’t you be my best man.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right-all right, fine! I-I’m gonna call the cops!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, I screwed up, you don’t have to turn me in!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not on you! On the stripper!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, well I already did that! They said they’re gonna look into it right after they solved all the murders.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, well, we’ll call the company that sent her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I did that too! They wouldn’t give me her real name or her number. They said, “If I bothered them again they’d call the police.” I said, “If you talk to the police, you tell them I’m missing a ring!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what, Joey? Wh-wh-what? What are you telling me? That there’s nothing we can do? Well, how could this happen?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look Ross, I am so-so sorry. I-I-I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what if we just ah, called her, used a fake name, and had her come to my office?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, that sounds like fun, but we’ve got a ring to find!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are cautiously serving Phoebe some tea.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here’s your tea Phoebe. (They give it to her and quickly take a step back.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s so good. (Monica and Rachel breath a sigh of relief.) Oh, thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so glad you liked it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! (Grabs her stomach in pain.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! She made the tea! (Points to Monica.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! No, I-I think I just had a contraction.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I thought I had one a couple of minutes ago, and now I know that was definitely one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, you can’t have the baby here! I mean I haven’t sterilised it since the guys moved out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. It’s okay. We’re gonna be okay. Y’know what? It’s okay. I’m gonna, I’m gonna, I’m gonna boil some water and just rip up some sheets!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. It’s all right; it’s probably false labour. They said that, that can happen near the end, just somebody get the book.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, get the book! The book!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! (Runs and grabs a book and hands it to Monica.) Okay! Here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The Bible?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know!

content.description: Chandler’s office, the guys are there waiting to ambush the stripper.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, okay, this is great, uh, Chandler, you get behind the desk. And-and when she comes in hopefully, she won’t recognise you because, well, why would she? Uh, okay, and then you buzz Ross and I. (to Ross) You be Mr. Gonzalez, and I’ll be uh, Mr. Wong.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Diverse.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Did anybody call for security?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You be cool. (He opens the door and lets her in as they all turn there backs on her.)

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Okay, which one of you guys is Gunther Central-Perk? (Sees Joey.) Hey, Joey?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where’s my ring? My dead grandmother’s wedding ring? Where is it? Where is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Way to be cool, man.

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: What’s he talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There was a ring, in a box, on my nightstand, after you left, it was gone!

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Wait, you guys think I stole some ring?

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We know you took so just-just save yourself the time and confess!

content.speaker: The Stripper
content.text: Okay, who are you? The Hardy boys? Look, I don’t need to steal some stupid ring, all right? I make $1,600 a week doing what I do; any of you guys make that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marry me. (Both Ross and Chandler hit him.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, the guys are now trying to figure out what next to do, since their plan with the stripper backfired on them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t get it! It was in my room all night! And if she didn’t take it, and I didn’t take it; and you (Chandler) didn’t take it, then who did? (The duck quacks.) Shh! We’re trying to think! (Ross and Chandler realise it at the same moment and stare at Joey, who doesn’t get it. After a short pause, with the duck still quacking, Joey figures it out and starts pointing at the duck.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is recovering from her false labour.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I still don’t get how you know when it’s false labour.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, do you see any babies?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do you feel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I guess. I mean… I don’t know, it’s just, I guess I know it’s going to be over soon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, isn’t that a good thing? You said you were sick of this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. It’s just y’know usually when you’re, when you’re done with the pregnant thing, y’know, then you get to do the mom thing. I’m gonna be y’know, sitting around in my leather pants, drinking Tequila.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Some moms do that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay that’s even sadder. Look, I know, I know what I got myself into, it’s just that now that they’re in me it’s like, it’s like I know them y’know, I mean-I mean, it’s just not gonna be easy when these little babies have to go away.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, sweetie, but it’s not like you’re not gonna have anything. You’re gonna have nieces and nephews, and some ways that’s even better.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, really. Really, Pheebs, you’re not gonna be the one worrying about saving for college, or yelling at them when they’re bad, y’know, or deciding to put them on Ritalin when they just won’t calm down. Y’know?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, you’re the one they’re gonna come to when they wanna run away from home, and the one they talk to about sex.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you just get to be cool Aunt Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cool Aunt Phoebe. I am pretty cool!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And y’know what else, oh my God, are they gonna love you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They are gonna love me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks you guys! Again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, sweetie! (They all hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re the best. Thanks. Oh!

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just kidding. Ahh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Got cha again, you guys are so easy.

content.description: The Animal Hospital, the guys have taken the duck in to remove the ring. Joey is pacing around like an expectant father.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If anything should happen to him…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey! The vet said it’s a simple procedure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So! Things can go wrong! You don’t know! What if he doesn’t make it?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He will, Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but what if he doesn’t? He’s such a good duck.

(With that we go into a little flashback about the guys’ memories of the duck. The first one is Joey playing with him in the bathtub and drying him off. Then it’s Chandler sitting on his couch after they moved into the girls apartment, and Chandler reading to him in bed, and him watching Baywatch when all they had was the canoe and the duck was in a bucket of water. Then we see Ross eating some cereal and the duck watching him. He takes a lamp and moves the duck off of the table. Then it’s Chandler shooing them out of the bathroom in the girls’ apartment, Joey revealing their disco cubby hole in the entertainment-center, then Chandler playing Hide-and-Go-Seek with them, and it’s concluded with various scenes with the duck flapping it’s wings. And the guys staring into the distance in remembrance of the duck.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m so worried about him, y’know?

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Somebody lose a ring?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! Thank you! Thank you so much! (He grabs the ring, kisses it, and then does a double-take realising where it’s been.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: H-h-h-how’s the duck?

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: He’s doing just fine, he’s resting now, but you can see him in a little bit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, great! Oh hey, listen Ross, thanks for being so cool about this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, that’s all right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, it’s not. I mean you-you made me your best man and I totally let you down!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, come on, it’s not your fault.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it is! You wouldn’t have lost the ring, right? Y’know what, Ross you were right from the start, he (Chandler) should be your best man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you should.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, don’t argue with me…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Hey! Hey! I get to choose my best man, and I want both you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, both you guys should be up there with me. I mean, you two are-are my… I mean, I’m lucky to have just one good… (They all start getting emotional.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotta go check something over here. (He walks away so that they can’t see him cry.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What a baby.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Total wuss!
(They both turn and wipe their eyes.)
[There was no closing scene, only a preview of the wedding.]
